action.action-desc: Mr. Gosar (for himself, Mr. Amodei of Nevada, Mr. Hamadeh of Arizona, Mr. Kennedy of Utah, Ms. Lee of Nevada, Ms. Maloy, Mr. Moore of Utah, Mr. Owens, and Ms. Titus) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act to include certain communities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Downwinders Parity Act of 2025.

section.header: Inclusion under the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act
section.text: Section 4(b)(1) of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (42 U.S.C. 2210 note; Public Law 101–426) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking that portion of; and
by striking that consists of townships 13 through 16 at ranges 63 through 71; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by inserting all acreage in any county all or part of which is located in before that part.

section.text: Section 3(d) of the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (42 U.S.C. 2210 note; Public Law 101–426) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking on the date that is 2 years after the date of enactment of the RECA Extension Act of 2022 and inserting on December 31, 2030; and
by striking the end of that 2-year period and inserting such date.

section.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Attorney General shall submit to the relevant committees of the Senate and the House of Representatives a report that outlines efforts to educate and conduct outreach to persons made newly eligible for benefits under the amendments made by section 2.
